author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Indian Council of Historical Research (ICHR) will provide monetary support to research scholars pursing fellowships to receive training from veteran art historians and archaeologists in order to understand Indian art, Professor Y. Sudershan Rao, Chairman, ICHR, said on Friday.

Delivering the inaugural address at a two-day conference on Iconography of the Hindus, Buddhists and Jains, organised by C.P. Ramaswamy Aiyar Institute of Indological Research as part of its golden jubilee celebrations, Prof. Rao said the vast pool of veteran Indian art historians and archaeologists, who retired many years ago, remain untapped.

“Each veteran Indian art historian should guide at least two researchers for their fellowships. This will strengthen the subject of Indian art,” Prof. Rao said.

On the occasion, he released books on iconography of Karttikeya by V. Sandhiyalakshmi and Deva Pratima jointly by H. Manikandan and Malathy Narasimhan.

Artist and scholar Padma Subramanyam honoured veteran archaeologists K.V. Raman and R. Nagaswamy, with Lifetime Achievement Awards for their contribution to Indian Art History.

Santosh Babu, Chairman and Managing Director, Tamil Nadu Handicrafts Development Corporation and Nanditha Krishna, director, CPR Institute of Indological Research, also spoke.
title: Iconography demystified
